newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: UTICO UNIT CHANGES NAME TO BAT S.AFRICA.
newsitem.headline: UTICO UNIT CHANGES NAME TO BAT S.AFRICA.

text.p: South Africa's United Tobacco Company, the main operating company of Utico Holdings Ltd, said on Monday it would change its name to British American Tobacco South Africa.
The company had been linked to the British American Tobacco companies for 90 years and said the move would help it compete more effectively worldwide.

"Our organisation is founded on one simple premise: that on a worldwide basis, we can compete more effectively as a single business than we can as individual, domestic-focused companies," the company said in a statement.

It said the process was designed to recapture the market share held 15 years ago by United Tobacco Company and to re-establish its brands, including Benson & Hedges, John Player, Gold Leaf and Embassy.
BAT Industries Plc has a 64 percent stake in Utico.
